page.title: 03SELWORTHY CHURCH & VILLAGE
page.content: This 14th century church(OS181920468) set on a south facing hillside with its two{chapels of ease: Tivington} (OS181933451) thatched dating from the 17th century dedicated to St Leonard and{Lynch}(OS181900476) built mid 15th century, serve North Hill,Selworthy beacon,Porlock Vale hamlets and local farms.The congregation no longer consists of the squire,his family and farmers comments Miss Ivy Cann,79 year old resident of Selworthy Green, instead it's made up of people from Minehead and Porlock and the 1500 visitors who now come each year.Just below the church,Selworthy Green,now a property of the National Trust,with its 17th century thatched cottages, {tithe barn}and rectory are the setting that attracts visitors from all over the world.
